Define Documentation

#define linked_list_foreach (   list,
  iter,
  iter_next,
  next_member 
)
Value:
for(iter = list, iter_next = (list != NULL) ? list->next_member \
                                                : NULL; \
        iter != NULL; \
        iter = iter_next, iter_next = (iter_next != NULL) ? \
                                      iter_next->next_member : NULL \
    )

Macro for iterating through a linked list.

Use it where you would include a for loop, following it with an opening bracket, your code, and a matching closing bracket.

Example of use:

 typedef struct my_list {
     int n;
     struct my_list *next;
 } my_list;
 
 my_list *head, *tail, *list_cur, *list_next;
 int i;
 
 for(i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
     my_list* item = malloc(sizeof(*item));

     item->n = i;
     item->next = NULL;

     if(head == NULL)
         head = item;
     else if(tail != NULL)
         tail->next = item;

     tail = item;
  }
  
 linked_list_foreach(head, list_cur, list_next, next) {
     printf("%d\n", list_cur->n);
 }
Parameters:
listPointer to the first node of the list
iterA variable with the type of a pointer to a list node, that will receive the current node during the iteration
iter_nextAn auxiliary variable with the type of a pointer to a list node that will hold a pointer to the next item to be visited during the iteration
next_memberName of the member of the list node type that holds a a pointer to the next item
#define linked_list_free (   list,
  type,
  next_member 
)
Value:
{ \
    type *iter__, *next__; \
    for(iter__ = list, next__ = (list != NULL) ? list->next_member : NULL; \
        iter__ != NULL; \
        iter__ = next__, next__ = (next__ != NULL) ? next__->next_member : NULL) \
    { \
        free(iter__); \
    } \
}

Iterates through a linked list free()'ing all it's items.

Parameters:
listThe linked list
typeThe type of the linked list nodes
next_memberName of the member of the list node that points to the next item
